our continual growth over the last 20 years has been no accident".

column11: With five factory trained technicians and the latest tech2 upgrades that cover the latest 9-3
and 9-5 Saab models, we offer servicing and repairs to factory standards using genuine Saab
parts and procedures. Despite this huge investment in equipment and expertise, our labour rates
are considerably less than your local Saab main agent and we believe we offer the best quality
and value available.
At Simply-Saab we make it our business to understand your needs and your vehicle's needs. We
have an approach that you will find very different from most other garages and car dealerships
that you may have used before.
All our technicians are attending the Saab Academy to gain regular updates on the latest Saab
vehicles being produced. We also do all our own gearbox and engine work in house, and do not
just exchange units when you may need a far smaller repair than replacing the whole unit.
Please call our workshop manager Steve Shute on (01179) 406121 for a quote or information on
the services we provide.
</font>

column1: of shelved new and used parts all maintained by a computerised
stock control system. This is one of the largest and
most comprehensive stocks of Saab parts anywhere in

column13: We dismantle over 500 Saabs per year and have contracts with most major insurance companies. This helps us
maintain good stock levels of most parts for all models produced between 1982 and 2004. It also helps us maintain
Our used parts are mainly taken from late vehicles that are in perfect mechanical condition, and typically
cost around 66% less than a new Saab part. All parts are inspected, cleaned and covered by our no quibble
We also carry a huge range of new Saab spares and we are backed by Saab as an Approved Impress Stock Agent.
We are usually able to offer a discount on any part that is not specially ordered.</font>

column1: <td colspan="4"><font id="para">We can deliver most parts
within 24 hours anywhere in the UK but we also send
Saab parts daily to any part of the world. We have been
supplying Saab parts to far-flung areas of the globe
for over 15 years and this operation now accounts for
a substantial part of our turnover. All parts are sent
through Parcelforce, they can be tracked on-line at any time
and, once again, all parts are covered by our 6-month

column10: <td colspan="4"><font id="para">If you're looking to purchase a used Saab, why not contact us with your requirements?

column11: We normally have a selection of excellent quality Saabs, each covered by our own warranty.
Many used cars sold in the UK are covered by insurance-backed warranty schemes which are often carefully worded so that
the policy will not pay out in the event of some common problems. Simply-Saab have taken a different, more transparent
approach and, apart from punctures or accident damage, we will repair your car free of charge in the warranty period.
At Simply-Saab we take pride when preparing all our vehicles for sale because we want you to return for your next Saab
in the future. Please take a look at www.Simply-Saab.com for further details.
We are also able to offer a selection of late Saabs direct from Norwich Union, General Accident and other major companies
at huge discounts. If these are of interest to you, please contact Kevin Brinton on (01179) 074298. These vehicles are prepared
to the same standard and are covered by the same warranty we offer on our own vehicles, but they do not appear on the Simply-Saab web site.
</font>

column10: <td colspan="4"><font id="para">South West Saab was started by Andy Caddick in 1987. At this early stage it was based in a

column11: glorified chicken hut on Park Road in Keynsham. At the time there was very little in the way of used parts or servicing available
to the Saab owning community in Bristol. Andy bought a few older Saabs and started advertising his parts and expertise in the local
press. This became the main part of the business and after 2 years Andy was working exclusively on Saab vehicles.
Over the following years and with constant investment in the premises, staff and equipment the company grew. Today they have a 16,000
sq.ft purpose-refurbished facility in Brislington.
They have also attained the ELV certificate, that allows them to de-pollute vehicles and reclaim materials for recycling. All manufacturers
will have to be responsible for a larger percentage of raw materials used by 2007 and Simply Saab will be at the forefront in helping Saab
to achieve this target.
The typical stereotype image of a back street garage is something Simply-Saab have worked hard to move away from. On visiting their
premises, you will find a large, modern workshop with resin floors and equipment that is well up to the standards you'll find at most
main dealerships. The reception area has a clean and contemporary feel with excellent fresh coffee if you are waiting for work to be
carried out on your vehicle.
</font>
